However, before you jump on the bandwagon, you should be aware that this method has its shortcomings. The Forex trader needs to not only be aware of this information at an early stage, but to effectively "second guess" how the money markets will react to it. The "carry" cost rewarded to hedge a future contract is the way from where the investors can make earnings, by selling or buying the difference left out of the actual carry cost of the contract. Sometimes the market feels compelled to test big figures, especially pivotal ones, to see if there are stops or bid/offers at these levels.
